alert.note: Alert for Central Panhandle Mountains; Coeur d'Alene Area; Idaho Palouse; Northern Panhandle (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 07 at 7:29AM MST until January 10 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY MORNING THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations between 6 and 12 inches in the valleys, and 1 to 2 feet in the mountains. Winds could gust as high as 50 mph Tuesday. * WHERE...Worley, Priest River, Mullan, Clark Fork, Athol, Bonners Ferry, Kellogg, Sandpoint, Plummer, St. Maries, Genesee, Moscow, Wallace, Fernwood, Dobson Pass, Osburn, Lookout Pass, Potlatch, Fourth Of July Pass, Schweitzer Mountain Road, Coeur d`Alene, Post Falls, Eastport, Pinehurst, and Hayden. * WHEN...From Monday morning through Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...The strong winds and weight of snow on tree limbs may bring down power lines and could cause sporadic power outages. Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the Monday morning and evening commutes.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
